title: Daily Aluminum price, LME SHFE Price of Aluminum live | SMM
summary: SHFE aluminum prices surged suddenly on January 28, 2026, with the most-traded contract reaching 25,345 yuan/mt, up 4.54% from the previous settlement. Open interest increased by about 68,000 contracts, showing heightened trading activity. Prices are consolidating at high levels due to macro factors despite limited supply-demand changes and high inventories.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum rose to 3,266.90 USD/T on January 28, 2026, up 1.76% from the previous day, with a 10.70% monthly gain and 24.60% yearly increase. It hit a near 4-year high of 3296.00 USD/T, the highest since April 2022, amid ongoing upward trends.

title: Metals Market Shaken as Aluminum Hits Fresh Peak Amid Four-Year Low for US Dollar
summary: Aluminum prices surged to $3,289.55 per tonne on the LME on January 28, 2026, a multi-year peak driven by tightening global supply and a weak US dollar, up 11% in January. Volatility is expected as the market balances demand, with potential to test $3,500 if the dollar weakens further. Producers like Alcoa and Rio Tinto may invest in capacity amid supply deficits.

title: US Aluminum Premium Tops $1 Per Pound For First Time
summary: The US Midwest aluminum premium reached $1.005 per pound on Wednesday, a record high due to President Trump's 50% tariffs on imports. This marks successive peaks since June, with US prices rising faster than global benchmarks amid tariff impacts.

title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
summary: US aluminum prices exceeded USD 5,000 per tonne as tariffs up to 50%, falling imports, low stocks, and Europe's supply issues create a 68% premium over LME prices. Effects include Century Aluminum restarting capacity, halted Russian imports due to EU sanctions, and China's production cap. Europe's CBAM adds costs for high-carbon imports.

title: Aluminium Futures Rise: Fresh Bets Fuel Price Surge
summary: Aluminum futures on the Multi Commodity Exchange rose 5.75% to Rs 350.50 per kg on January 29, 2026, driven by speculators building positions amid positive spot trends and industry demand. The February contract saw significant volume in trading.

title: Aluminum Hits Near 4-Year High
summary: UK aluminum futures exceeded $3,280 per tonne, reaching the highest since April 2022, fueled by tightening global supply constraints.

title: Alcoa (AA) Projects Increased Alumina and Aluminum Production for 2026
summary: Alcoa plans to increase Alumina production to 9.7-9.9 million metric tons and Aluminum production to 2.4-2.6 million metric tons by 2026, driven by enhanced productivity and smelter restarts. Alumina shipments are expected at 11.8-12.0 million metric tons, while Aluminum shipments range from 2.6-2.8 million metric tons. Operational challenges in Q1 2026 may reduce Adjusted EBITDA by $30 million in Alumina and $70 million in Aluminum due to maintenance and costs.

title: Century to take 40% of project to build first US aluminum smelter in 46 years
summary: Century Aluminum and Emirates Global Aluminium announced a joint venture on Jan. 26, 2026, with Century holding 40% stake to build a 750,000 metric tons per year smelter in Inola, Oklahoma—the first US aluminum smelter in nearly 50 years. Construction starts by end of 2026 using EGA's EX technology, creating 1,000 permanent and 4,000 construction jobs while doubling US output. The project shifts from a prior Kentucky plan due to power issues and supports domestic production amid high import reliance.

title: High-purity alumina HPA First Project bags $175 million
summary: Alpha HPA secured a $75 million investment from Australia's National Reconstruction Fund for its HPA First Project in Gladstone, producing ultra-high purity alumina for semiconductors, lithium-ion batteries, and pharmaceuticals. The project uses 100% renewable energy via Smart SX Technology, recycling nearly 100% of reagents to yield 5N+ purity materials. It positions Australia as a key supplier in global supply chains for AI and critical manufacturing.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 967.08 USD/T on January 29, 2026, down 0.51% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.32%. Earlier on January 28, it rose to 969.05 USD/T, up 0.42%.

title: Stainless Steel Prices, Inventory & Insights in China from Jan 12th to Jan 25th
summary: The main stainless steel contract rose by US$65/MT to US$2245/MT, up 3.15% from last week. On January 26th, futures rose 0.51% to close at US$2245/MT, with Tsingshan Indonesia raising 304 export quotes by $30/MT for the fourth time in January. Spot prices for cold and hot-rolled 304 strengthened, supported by rising raw material costs.

title: SMM Stainless Steel Daily Review: SHFE Nickel Weakness + Pre-Holiday Demand Slump
summary: Stainless steel futures declined due to SHFE nickel weakness and pre-holiday demand slump, with intraday low at 14,260 yuan/mt. Spot market showed sluggish trading. Social inventory remains low amid bullish sentiment.

title: US scrap trends outlook: January 2026
summary: The US ferrous scrap market enters January 2026 with a bullish outlook, Trend Indicator at 57.3 forecasting a 3.2% month-on-month price increase. Buyers are most bullish, with stable inventories and tight supply supporting prices. Modest gains expected amid low flows and no major shifts.

title: US Steel Production Up 4.6% Year-on-Year in Late January 2026
summary: U.S. raw steel production increased 4.6% year-on-year for the week ending January 24, 2026, reaching 1.78 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 76.9%. Year-to-date production through January 24 totaled 6.016 million net tons, up 3.4% compared to the same period last year, with broad-based production strength across all major U.S. steelmaking regions.

title: US raw steel production is up 1.3 percent - week 4, 2026
summary: According to AISI data, U.S. domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 24, 2026, was 1.778 million net tons with a 76.9% capacity utilization rate, representing a 1.3% increase from the previous week. The production level marks a 4.6% increase compared to the same week in 2025.

title: Steel Falls as China Output Declines
summary: Steel rebar futures fell toward CNY 3,100 per ton after China's steel production sank to a seven-year low in 2025, dropping 4.4% to 961 million tons. Weak domestic demand in China's property sector and government restrictions on new capacity continue to pressure global steel markets.

title: CHAMPION IRON REPORTS ITS FY2026 THIRD QUARTER RESULTS AND ADVANCES THE DRPF PROJECT AS PLANNED
summary: Champion Iron reported improved iron ore concentrate production in Q3 FY2026, with Fe recovery rates reaching 79.7% compared to 79.1% in the prior year period. The company's DRPF project to upgrade Bloom Lake's capacity to DR quality pellet feed iron ore is progressing as planned, with initial commercial shipments anticipated by the end of the first half of 2026.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is rebounding with innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap steel, reducing reliance on coal and cutting emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are advancing coal-free processes using renewable energy and chemical reactions, making production more energy-efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods or even Chinese production. These technologies promise full decarbonization of steelmaking amid rising investor interest.

title: Future of Steel: Trends, Technology & Sustainability 2026
summary: The article examines upcoming trends in steel production, focusing on sustainability, scrap recycling, and new low-carbon technologies set to reshape the industry by 2026. It highlights innovations aimed at reducing environmental impact through advanced methods. This forward-looking piece discusses how these developments will influence the sector's future.

title: Video. Inside Europe's booming push for green steel factories
summary: The video explores a small EU family business that has become a global leader in clean steel production through European technological innovations. It showcases the development of green metallurgical plants aimed at sustainable steelmaking. This coverage is part of Euronews' latest bulletins highlighting Europe's push for eco-friendly manufacturing.

title: Copper Hits Record Highs: Geopolitical Tensions and Dollar Impact
summary: Copper prices hit record highs amid geopolitical risks and a weak dollar, with the Shanghai Futures Exchange contract surging 6.35% to 108,740 yuan per metric ton and the London Metal Exchange benchmark climbing 6.63% to $13,953.50 a ton. The rally follows significant yearly gains fueled by supply concerns from mine disruptions and U.S. tariff threats. Other metals like zinc, lead, nickel, and tin also advanced.

title: Ivanhoe Collaborates with SQM to Explore for Copper in Chile; LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
summary: LME copper opened at $13,111/mt overnight, fluctuated significantly, and closed at $13,120/mt, up 0.74%. Shanghai SHFE copper showed a 'V' shape, closing at 103,170 yuan/mt after probing a low. Imported and secondary copper prices saw slight declines in premiums.

title: Copper Rallies to All-Time High
summary: Copper futures surged nearly 7% to above $6.3 per pound, hitting record highs driven by demand for real assets amid geopolitical and trade uncertainties, including U.S. President Trump's threats against Iran, and a sudden dollar drop. The price reached an all-time high of 6.11 USD/Lbs.

title: Gold and Copper Lead Metals Rally, Dollar Weakens: Markets Wrap
summary: Copper jumped 5% on the London Metal Exchange as part of a broader metals rally led by gold and silver, benefiting from a weakening dollar that makes dollar-denominated assets more attractive. Brent crude also climbed to its highest since September amid the market movements.

title: Ivanhoe Collaborates with SQM to Explore for Copper in Chile
summary: Ivanhoe has partnered with SQM to explore for copper resources in Chile. LME copper futures opened at $13,111/mt and closed at $13,120/mt with a 0.74% gain, while spot prices across Shanghai, imported copper, and secondary copper markets showed mixed movements.

title: Copper Price Rally: Mining Stocks Rise on AI Demand
summary: Copper prices have rallied to around $13,000 per metric ton, driving gains in mining stocks as technological demand, particularly from AI applications, supports the commodity. The price surge reflects broader market momentum in the metals sector.

title: Gold and Copper Lead Metals Rally, Dollar Weakens: Markets Wrap
summary: Copper jumped 5% on the London Metal Exchange as part of a broader commodities rally, hitting all-time highs alongside gold and silver amid a weaker dollar and rising geopolitical tensions. The rally was supported by currency weakness, as these dollar-priced assets benefited from greenback decline.

title: Mantoverde makes workers new offer as strike continues
summary: Mantoverde copper mine in Chile has made a new offer to workers amid ongoing strike action. In 2025, the operation produced 62,308 tons of copper sulfide concentrate and 32,807 tons of copper cathodes, representing approximately 0.4% of global copper production.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is partnering with Rio Tinto to source low-carbon copper produced via Nuton technology for U.S. data centers. Nuton uses microorganisms to extract copper from sulphide ores, reducing water and emissions intensity while eliminating traditional smelters. The collaboration leverages AWS's cloud analytics to optimize the process, supporting sustainability in copper supply for growing digital infrastructure.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS are collaborating to supply low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centers. The Nuton technology produces high-purity copper cathode at the mine site using bioleaching, shortening the production chain and lowering emissions. This partnership highlights innovation in sustainable copper production for tech infrastructure.

title: How one startup is using prebiotics to try and ease the copper shortage
summary: Startup Transition Metal Solutions is developing prebiotic additives to enhance microbial performance in copper extraction, potentially boosting production by 20-30% and recovery rates to 90%. The technology targets low-grade ores left behind in traditional mining, addressing impending copper shortages driven by AI and electrification demand. The company plans third-party lab testing followed by field demonstrations.

title: Nickel Rebounds Sharply as Market Enters Era of Elevated Volatility
summary: Nickel prices have rebounded significantly, breaking through previous oscillating ranges, with the main Shanghai nickel contract approaching 150,000 yuan per ton. The rebound is driven by macro fund inflows, while refined nickel has become the strongest-performing segment in the industrial chain. Despite surplus pressures, the scale of bottom-fishing funds remains substantial with no signs of withdrawal.

title: Canada Nickel: Strategic Bet on Rising Market Fundamentals
summary: Nickel prices reached 19-month highs of $18,785/tonne in early January 2026 and are currently trading at $18,085/tonne as Indonesia cuts ore quotas by 34% to 250-260 million tonnes. This supply discipline, combined with recovering Chinese stainless steel demand, creates opportunities for Western producers like Canada Nickel Company, with technical analysis showing a 30-day gain of 19.28%.

title: NIC: Record EBITDA margins, strategic asset sale, and strong nickel prices drive positive outlook
summary: Analysis of nickel market dynamics highlighting record EBITDA margins and strategic asset sales benefiting from strong nickel prices and positive market outlook.

title: Nornickel Nickel Output Forecast 2026: 193K-203K Tons
summary: Nornickel projects nickel output of 193,000-203,000 metric tons for 2026. This forecast maintains stability amid transitions in ore grades. The projection reflects ongoing production complexities in the nickel market.

title: Nickel Industries December 2025 quarter: Strong HPAL margins, mining rebounds
summary: Nickel Industries reported US$37.3 million adjusted EBITDA for Q4 2025, with strong HPAL margins despite mining delays from late government approval. Operations rebounded, targeting over 1.4 million wet metric tonnes of ore sales in January. The company anticipates a higher 2026 mining quota of 19 million wmt and progress on the ENC HPAL project.

title: If weather cooperates: Global Ferronickel eyes 1.5-million-ton nickel output from Palawan mine
summary: Global Ferronickel aims for 1.5 million tons of nickel output from its Palawan mine, contingent on favorable weather conditions. The target highlights potential production capacity expansion. Weather cooperation is key to achieving this goal.

title: Nickel Mines Q4 2025 slides: HPAL strength offsets mining challenges
summary: Nickel Mines' HPAL operations produced 2,144 tonnes of nickel at 43% above nameplate capacity, with attributable EBITDA up 32% to US$17.2 million. RKEF production rose 1% to 31,561 tonnes despite EBITDA decline. The ENC project advances toward commissioning, supported by a major solar project for low-carbon production.

title: Nickel Industries’ projects advance as ENC nears commissioning
summary: Australia-listed Nickel Industries Ltd reported continued progress on its key nickel projects in Indonesia. The ENC project nears commissioning. Details on advancements were highlighted in the update.

title: Nickel Industries Limited, Q4 2025 Earnings Call, Jan 29, 2026
summary: Nickel Industries held its Q4 2025 earnings call on January 29, 2026, discussing quarterly activities. The webcast covered operational updates and operator instructions. It provides insights into recent production and financial performance.

title: Arca and Giga Metals sign exclusive agreement to explore carbon removal at B.C. nickel project
summary: Arca Climate Technologies and Giga Metals have signed an exclusive agreement to explore carbon removal technologies at a nickel project in British Columbia. This initiative aims to integrate carbon capture innovations into nickel production for enhanced sustainability. The partnership supports sustainable mining practices amid growing demand for green nickel.

title: Nickel Industries Limited, Q4 2025 Earnings Call
summary: Nickel Industries Limited held its Q4 2025 earnings call on January 29, 2026, discussing financial performance and operational updates. The transcript covers nickel production advancements and potential sustainability innovations in their operations. This reflects ongoing developments in the nickel sector relevant to technology and market sustainability.

title: The growing role of critical minerals in global innovation
summary: The article discusses the escalating demand for critical minerals like nickel in clean energy technologies to achieve net zero by 2050. It emphasizes the need for innovative, responsible mining practices to balance environmental protection and supply growth. Leaders at the 2026 Annual Meeting will explore sustainable sourcing strategies.

title: Causeartist's 2026 Social Impact Entrepreneur Power List
summary: Redwood Materials, led by JB Straubel, is highlighted for recovering 95% of nickel and other metals from EV batteries, creating closed-loop supply chains. The company advances sustainable battery recycling technology, reducing mining dependency. It has raised over $2 billion and partnered with major automakers for scaled operations.
